originalText.text: Dr Mendoza, is phenomenal. I originally visited this location back in January for a physical.  I haven’t  had one in years and I was kind of hesitant to visit  a doctor’s office due to fear of having health issues I didn’t want to know about. Dr Mendoza was kind and informative, he definitely makes you feel comfortable to discuss any concerns you have. Due to this great visit, I have since had two of my close friends also attend this office and have visits with him personally. When he told me he also sees children I changed my son now to this location. He had his first visit with Dr Mendoza and he is fantastic with kids, definitely makes them informed about their own body and apart of any action plan that is needed to better their health. He did not rush and took his time. Most doctors rush through visits only addressing why you came not asking further questions that can enhance the visit. Dr Mendoza address many things without being prompted, he explained clear and with language that is easy for any one to understand. Will continue to visit this office and recommend this location due to the amazing service I have gotten from Dr Mendoza.

originalText.text: I seen Dr. Mendoza today and I’m extremely satisfied. Not only was he very polite he made sure that I understood literally everything and was very open to answering and addressing all my questions and concerns. It’s been a long time since I felt like every single base possible was covered after leaving a doctor’s office. To top it off the staff was great and very nice as well. I would highly recommend Dr. Mendoza as well as this facility.

I would highly recommend Dr. Mendoza as well as this facility.

originalText.text:
TLDR; Good standard of care, obnoxious late policy

I’ve became a patient at Juno Medical when my OBGYN joined the practice. I mentioned to her that I needed a primary care physician and she mentioned that this practice had them, so I made an appointment.

I’ve been had a few primary care physician appointments here without incident. I normally go once a year for routine checkups.

I scheduled a follow-up appointment this last Friday with Dr. Mendoza. Apparently they’ve changed the late policy to a five minute grace period since I last went.

After traveling from Brooklyn to Harlem, I got to the office at 4:37 p.m. for my scheduled 4:30 appointment. I was informed by the receptionist that I had passed the five minute period ( by two minutes) and that I may have to reschedule. The receptionist then told me that I had to reschedule bc the doctor was with another patient. It was the end of the day, but no one else was in the waiting room. I declined and left. I’d wasted an hour traveling to the doctor to be turned away, why would I want to reschedule with a medical practice with, what I believe to be, an unreasonable late policy. It’s NYC, things happen while commuting.

As I reached the train, I received a message that my appointment had been cancelled ( by Juno Medical) and that I was now going to be charged a $30 cancellation fee for an appointment that I DID NOT CANCEL outside of the cancellation window.

Before I get the autogenerated response to this review, I’ve already emailed my grievances to the Juno email. Btw, emailing or sending a portal message is the only way to get in contact with a live person at this practice.

I was excited for this medical practice, as they staff POC. The standard of care offered is good, which is the only reason I gave three stars, but you’ve lost a patient due to your inflexible lateness policy.

It’s hard enough finding black and brown physicians and this policy adds another barrier to care and medical access.

originalText.text: One word...terrible!  I was only 15 minutes late to a 7:30am appointment on a Thursday and had already been marked down as a "no show".  I am 34 weeks pregnant and commuted from Westchester.  I was also informed, after the fact, that either way the doctor would not have seen me because they don't have the "equipment" to accomodate 36+ weeks pregnant women.  As I mentioned I'm only 34 weeks along and it would have been nice if the person who called me the day prior to confirm the appointment would have let me know I wasn't going to be able to be seen.  This was such a waste of time, I requested a late start for work and I paid for  parking at a local garage to make this appointment.  I tried to call the front desk on my way in to let them know I was running a little behind but no one picked up.  I get it, I was 15 minutes late, but this practice should be more understanding/flexible with their patients.  This practice is all about money, I do not recommend Juno!

originalText.text: Unresponsive to emails on prescription refills, and I received a $900 medical bill for an annual routine lab. Someone said all their mistakes become your problem to solve - this is very true. The staff are nice but it's easy to fall through the cracks here.
